team_members.name: HG Sarvabhuta Devi Dasi
team_members.description:
HG Sarvabhuta Devi Dasi (wife of HG Rasanath Das) born and brought up in Kalyan - Maharashtra, Sarvabhuta Mataji is a disciple of HH Bhakti Raghav Swami Maharaj (HDGSP), she is an experienced and trained teacher having more than 15 years of experience in teaching, she has completed her Msc in Environment Science and BEd (Science & Maths) from Mumbai University, 
Prior to working as a teacher, she was working with one of the leading home automation company in the capacity of CDM (clean development management) program manager.
She is now serving as the Principal of BVG (Murbad) where she looks after the education and wellbeing of our kids.

team_members.name: HG Rasanath Das
team_members.description:
Rasanath Das also born and brought up in Kalyan - Maharashtra, is also a disciple of HH Bhakti Raghav Swami Maharaj (HDGSP), he has completed his Graduation in Physics (Mumbai University) and post-graduation in finance (Welingkar institute of Management, Mumbai), he is currently serving in one of the leading investment banks, 
He takes care of the administrative seva in the Gurukul along with teaching kids spiritual subjects like Srimad Bhagavad Gita and Srila Prabhupada's books.

team_members.name: Bhakt Prasad Barakade
team_members.description: Prasad Prabhu hails from Satara - Maharashtra, he is currently pursuing Graduation in Samskrit from IGNOU, he is engaged as a full time teacher in the Gurukul, covering subjects like Marathi and Hindi for students of std-5 to std-8, he is also a district level sportsperson (Wrestling) and looks after the physical fitness of our kids.

seo_title_academics: Our Curriculum & Daily Life | BVG Murbad
seo_description_academics: Explore the academic and spiritual curriculum at BVG Murbad, including our daily schedule, subjects taught, and practical skills development.
spiritual_curriculum_title: Spiritual Syllabus: The Heart of Our Education
spiritual_curriculum_text:
Our spiritual syllabus is the foundation of our educational philosophy, designed to nurture a student's character, values, and connection to our sacred traditions. The curriculum covers the essential scriptures as commented on by HDG A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada, including:

* Srimad Bhagavad Gita
* Srimad Bhagavatam
* Mahabharata & Ramayan
* Isopanishad
* Important Pranam Mantras and Stotras
academic_curriculum_title: Academic Syllabus: Preparing for the Future
academic_curriculum_text:
To ensure our students are well-prepared for modern life and have opportunities for higher education, we follow the curriculum of recognized educational boards:

* **For Std. 5th to Std. 8th:** We follow the MSBOS Board (Maharashtra State Board for Open Schooling).
* **For Std. 10th:** We follow the NIOS Board (National Institute of Open Schooling).
practical_skills_text:
Beyond the classroom, we believe in holistic development through hands-on training. This approach helps students build competence and self-reliance. Practical skills taught at the Gurukul include:

* Practical Farming
* Sports and Martial Arts
* Music (Vocals and Instruments)
* Cooking and Prasadam distribution
seo_description_admissions: Learn about the admissions process at Bhaktivedanta Vidyabhavan Gurukula and find answers to frequently asked questions.
admissions_intro_text: Take the first step towards a transformative education grounded in spiritual values. Below you will find our inquiry form and answers to common questions about our admissions process.

faq.question: What are the fees for the Gurukula?
faq.answer: In line with our guiding vision that education should be available to all, we do not charge any mandatory or forceful fees for tuition or boarding. Our Gurukul operates on the principles of seva and heartfelt contributions from the community.

faq.question: How can parents contribute to their child's education?
faq.answer: While there are no fixed fees, parents are encouraged to contribute according to their capacity. You can support the Gurukula by sponsoring your child's daily prasadam and other needs, or by offering other forms of seva. We believe this creates a wonderful partnership in the child's upbringing.

faq.question: What is the ideal age for admission?
faq.answer: We primarily accept students for the 5th standard, as this is an ideal age to begin foundational spiritual and academic training in a Gurukula environment.

faq.question: Is this a residential (boarding) program?
faq.answer: Yes, Bhaktivedanta Vidyabhavan is a full-time residential program. Students live in a nurturing and disciplined ashram environment which is essential for their holistic development.
